skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.
skill.summary: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/sp...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL Anthropic skill with standard PDF processing utilities. All scripts use legitimate Python libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, pdf2image) for document manipulation without external network calls or dangerous operations.

content.value_statement: Extract text and tables from PDFs, fill out forms (both fillable and non-fillable), merge/split documents, and create new PDFs programmatically with Python.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDFs with layout preservation
Fill both fillable PDF forms and non-fillable forms using visual annotation
Merge multiple PDFs or split PDFs into individual pages
Create new PDFs from scratch with text, tables, and styling
Extract metadata, images, and form field information
Rotate pages, add watermarks, and password-protect PDFs
Convert PDFs to images for visual analysis
Validate form field bounding boxes with visual debugging
OCR support for scanned PDFs using pytesseract
limitations: OCR for scanned PDFs requires additional dependencies (pytesseract, pdf2image)
Non-fillable forms require manual bounding box identification through visual analysis
Form field font size and color may not render consistently across all PDF viewers
Complex table extraction may require custom settings tuning
Image-based PDFs require OCR processing which is slower

best_practices: Always run check_fillable_fields.py first to determine if a PDF has fillable form fields before choosing an approach
For non-fillable forms, always create and visually inspect validation images to verify bounding boxes before filling
Use pdfplumber for text/table extraction instead of basic pypdf.extract_text() for better layout preservation
When filling forms, provide clear field descriptions in field_values.json to maintain clarity
For large batch operations, implement error handling and process documents in chunks to manage memory
Use qpdf for command-line operations when speed is critical
Always verify checkbox values (checked_value/unchecked_value) before filling checkbox fields
anti_patterns: Skipping the validation image creation step for non-fillable forms (leads to misaligned text)
Assuming all PDFs have fillable fields without checking first
Using entry bounding boxes that overlap with label bounding boxes
Filling forms without running check_bounding_boxes.py to validate coordinates
Trying to fill checkbox fields without verifying the correct checked/unchecked values
Processing very large PDFs entirely in memory instead of using streaming approaches

faq.question: How do I know if my PDF has fillable form fields?
faq.answer: Run `python scripts/check_fillable_fields.py <file.pdf>` from the skill directory. It will tell you if the PDF has fillable fields or if you need to use visual annotation.

faq.question: What's the difference between fillable and non-fillable forms?
faq.answer: Fillable forms have embedded form field definitions that can be programmatically set. Non-fillable forms are just static images/text, requiring you to identify bounding boxes visually and add text annotations on top.

faq.question: Why do my bounding boxes need validation?
faq.answer: Validation ensures label and entry bounding boxes don't overlap and that entry boxes are tall enough for the text. The validation images show blue (label) and red (entry) rectangles so you can visually verify correct placement before filling the form.

faq.question: Can this skill handle scanned PDFs?
faq.answer: Yes, but scanned PDFs require OCR. Install pytesseract and pdf2image, then use the OCR extraction workflow described in reference.md to convert images to text first.

faq.question: What libraries does this skill use?
faq.answer: Python: pypdf (merge/split/basic ops), pdfplumber (text/table extraction), reportlab (PDF creation), pdf2image (image conversion), pytesseract (OCR). Command-line: poppler-utils (pdftotext, pdfimages), qpdf (advanced manipulation).

permissions: File system read/write access for PDF files
